abstract: Returning from vacation, I arrived home to find at my doorstop the latest issue of Portfolio, the not-quite-new Conde Nast business magazine, whose media critic is one Howell Raines, the former executive editor of The New York Times who left a couple of years before I got here. Anyway, I just read, somewhat dumbfounded, his latest column. It’s about how all of us in business journalism are being sandbagged by those awful people running Exxon Mobil and the other major oil companies, who are busy gouging us while tossing the press their “malarkey” about supply and demand being behind the rise in oil prices. Raines, apparently, is among the legions who believe it’s all a big plot by Big Oil, which could bring down the price with a snap of its powerful finger.
